page.title: 06Farming in the Colne Valley
page.content: The Colne Valley is a semi- rural area with lots of small farms on the hilltops and valley sides. Because of the climate and soil most of the farms have dairy herds and sheep. The Roberts' farm at Linthwaite is typical of the area. It is a dairy farm of 100 acres, 50% being used for grazing a herd of 50 friesian cows, and 50% used for growing hay and silage.Winter for the farmer starts in late October when the cows are brought indoors and lasts approximately 200 days. The herd produces 150 gallons a day of which two thirds is bottled at the farm and is delivered daily by the farmer to houses in the locality. The rest of his milk goes to produce cream.
